customer_addr:
1736 Y.O. Ranch Rd
Mt. Home, TX 78058

citations.narrative:
The wooden doors of the giraffe barn are deteriorating.There is splintered wood and exposed nails on the doors that could
be reached by the giraffe.
Loose boards and hay wire are on the ground . A hay feeder is on the barn floor and 50 gallon plastic barrel is in the
surrounding pen. These are not secured to the walls or fence line , A V shape metal support structure extends along the
back wall of both giraffe stalls in the barn . The pen fence at the front of the barn is bent down in several sections. . The
deteriorating wooden door with exposed nails, and other items described above may cause injury to giraffe. The head
/neck of a giraffe could become trapped in the V shaped metal structure. The facility must be constructed of such material
and of such strength as appropriate for the animals involved. The indoor and outdoor housing facilities shall be structurally
sound and shall be maintained in good repair to protect the animals from injury and to contain the animals.. These areas
must be repaired or replaced and maintained in good repair to protect the animals from injury.
CORRECT BY : 4/14/2024

citations.desc: Environment enhancement to promote psychological well-being.
citations.narrative:
The facility was unaware that birds are now regulated and has not yet developed an appropriate plan for environmental
enhancement for the 3 ostrich and 4 rhea . Dealers, exhibitors, and research facilities must develop, document, and follow
a species-appropriate plan for environment enhancement adequate to promote the psychological well-being of birds. The
plan must be approved by the attending veterinarian and must be in accordance with the regulations in this subpart and
with currently accepted professional standards as cited in appropriate professional journals or reference guides.
CORRECT BY : 4/14/2024
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the manager .
n

narrative:
3.125(a) 
   
Facilities, general. 
The wooden doors of the giraffe barn are deteriorating.There is splintered wood and exposed nails on the doors that could 
be reached by the giraffe.  
Loose boards and hay wire are on the ground . A hay feeder is on the barn floor and 50 gallon plastic barrel is in the 
surrounding pen. These are not secured to the walls or fence line , A V shape metal support structure extends along the 
back wall of both giraffe stalls in the barn . The pen fence at the front of the barn is bent down in several sections. . The 
deteriorating wooden door with exposed nails, and other items described above may cause injury to giraffe. The head 
/neck of a giraffe could become trapped in the V shaped metal structure. The facility must be constructed of such material 
and of such strength as appropriate for the animals involved. The indoor and outdoor housing facilities shall be structurally 
sound and shall be maintained in good repair to protect the animals from injury and to contain the animals.. These areas 
must be repaired or replaced and maintained in good repair to protect the animals from injury. 
CORRECT BY : 4/14/2024 
3.154 
   
Environment enhancement to promote psychological well-being. 
The facility was unaware that birds are now regulated and has not yet developed an appropriate plan for environmental 
enhancement for the 3 ostrich and 4 rhea . Dealers, exhibitors, and research facilities must develop, document, and follow 
a species-appropriate plan for environment enhancement adequate to promote the psychological well-being of birds. The 
plan must be approved by the attending veterinarian and must be in accordance with the regulations in this subpart and 
with currently accepted professional standards as cited in appropriate professional journals or reference guides. 
CORRECT BY : 4/14/2024 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the manager .
